topic: Telix to Participate in UBS and Jefferies Global Healthcare Conferences

ideas.title: Telix's Punt
ideas.premise: A Telix executive, dressed in corporate attire, is punting a giant radiopharmaceutical down the Yarra River, explaining to a confused tourist that it's 'innovative healthcare outreach'.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposes serious healthcare with a very Melbourne, informal activity.

ideas.title: Healthcare Hype Train
ideas.premise: A packed Melbourne tram (86 to Docklands) labeled 'Healthcare Hype Train' has Telix executives frantically handing out radiopharmaceuticals as tickets to UBS and Jefferies reps.
ideas.why_funny: Relatable tram chaos, exaggerating conference buzz and free stuff.

ideas.title: Laneway Logistics
ideas.premise: Telix scientists are attempting to deliver radiopharmaceuticals through a tiny Melbourne laneway, getting stuck behind a hipster cafe's outdoor seating.
ideas.why_funny: Highlights both the complexity of pharmaceuticals and Melbourne's quirky laneways.

ideas.title: Esky Economics
ideas.premise: Two finance guys in suits, sitting outside Federation Square, are trying to understand Telix's potential while eating sausage rolls and drinking VB from an esky.
ideas.why_funny: Combines finance jargon with classic Aussie stereotypes.

ideas.title: Radionuclide Roulette
ideas.premise: A casino scene, but instead of roulette, people are betting on different radiopharmaceuticals, with Jefferies and UBS representatives as the croupiers.
ideas.why_funny: Visually engaging and satirizes the gambling nature of investments.
